III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & Rule 400.10103 (1) A facility shall have a current written
Section program statement which specifically addresses all of the
Description following: (c) written policies and procedures pertaining to
the admission, care, and release of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 had an inappropriate relationship with Youth A. Staff 1
gave gifts to Youth A upon his release and would kiss Youth A on
the lips. Staff 1 gave her contact information to Youth A when he
left the facility. Another unknown youth kissed Staff 1’s hand and
Staff 1 was unaffected by it.
Investigation On 2/20/24, I spoke to DHHS Worker 1; allegations and
scheduling was discussed.
On 2/21/24, I spoke to Administrator 1; allegations and
scheduling were discussed. No new information was provided.
On 2/26/24, I spoke to Complainant 1. Complainant 1 reported
Staff 1 received flowers on February 14 in which a variety of staff
reported they came from Youth A.
Interviews:
Youth A was unable to be reached by this consultant. A voicemail
was left on 4/1/24. Youth A did not return the phone call.
Youth C was not interviewed. He is no longer at the facility. Youth
C is a legal adult, and the agency was unable to provide his
whereabouts.
The following Interviews were conducted face to face at the facility
on 2/26/24:
Youth B
Youth B reported he was in the same unit as Youth A and Youth C
when they were placed at the facility. Youth B reported he saw
Youth C kiss Staff 1’s hand in the day room. Youth B reported this
happened after 10:00pm. Youth B was unable to provide dates.
Youth B reported Staff 1 did not react to the kiss. Youth B reported
there were no other staff or youth around. Youth B reported at
bedtime, on another occasion, he saw Staff 1 kiss Youth A on the
2

lips while Staff 1 was in Youth A’s doorway. Youth B reported his
bedroom was across the hallway from Youth A’s bedroom. Youth
B reported no one else was around to witness the kiss. Youth B
reported this was the only time he saw them kiss. Youth B
reported Staff 1 brought Youth A extra popcorn, cookies, and
chips. Youth B stated this occurred less than 5 times. Youth B was
unsure if others knew about the extra snacks.
Staff 1
Staff 1 reported she brings in extra snacks for all the youth during
group and when all the youth are doing well together. Staff 1
reported she has received supervision approval for this. Staff 1
reported she has never given Youth A snacks without giving other
youth snacks. Staff 1 reported she was told by an unknown staff
Youth A had a “crush” on her. Staff 1 reported she talked to Youth
A directly and made it clear to him that this was inappropriate.
Staff 1 then reported this information to Supervisor 1. Staff 1
reported this happened a few months ago. Staff 1 reported
sometime after this, Staff 2 came to her and reported Youth A
stated in class, he and Staff 1 were going to live together when
Youth A gets out of the facility. Staff 1 reported she told Staff 2
this wasn’t true. After this conversation, Staff 1 went to Supervisor
2 and reported what was told to her and was upset this was not
taken care of by now. Staff 1 reported she felt rumors were being
started and the supervisors were not taking care of it. Staff 1
reported she did not kiss Youth A, nor give him extra snacks. Staff
1 reported she never gave Youth A her contact information and
never stated they could live together. Staff 1 reported she has
never been kissed by any youth, including Youth C. Staff 1
reported she received flowers at the facility on February 14, from
her ex-husband.
The following are interviews conducted via telephone with DHHS
Worker 1 on 2/29/24.
Supervisor 2:
Supervisor 2 reported sometime in November 2023, she received
information from Staff 2. that Youth A stated he was going to live
with Staff 1 when he left the facility. Supervisor 2 reported she
talked to Staff 1 concerning this and Staff 1 denied it and reported
Staff 2 is spreading rumors. Supervisor 1 reported she deemed it
rumors and didn’t do anything else with the information.
Supervisor 2 did not feel the information was valid. Supervisor 2
reported there were flowers sent to the facility for Staff 1. She
reported the card said, “from your soul mate.” Supervisor 2
reported she has no concerns with Staff 1 and no red flags from
3

Staff 1 that would make her think she was apart of any
inappropriate behavior with any youth.
Supervisor 1:
Supervisor 1 reported she has not had any concerns with Staff 1.
Supervisor 1 is her direct supervisor. Supervisor 1 reported she
heard rumors that Staff 1 was going to allow Youth A to live at her
house when he left the facility, but she reported that rumors are
very common at the center. Supervisor 1 did not remember who
provided her the rumors. Supervisor 1 reported could not
remember who provided these rumors. Supervisor 1 referred to it
as “hazing” from the older staff. She never had any concerns
regarding Staff 1’s interactions, boundaries, or relationship with
Youth A. She has never seen Staff 1 bring in snacks in an
unusual or inappropriate way. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 had
approval to bring snacks in when she did. Supervisor 1 reported
she was not there for the flowers.
Supervisor 3:
Supervisor 3 reported he has never seen Staff 1 be inappropriate
with any youth including Youth A. Supervisor 3 reported Staff 1
received flowers, but he was unaware where they came from.
Supervisor 3 reported Staff 1 brought in snacks for the youth, but
this was allowed.
Staff 4
Staff 4 reported he had heard rumors that Youth A wanted to live
with Staff 1 and that there was a flower delivery from Youth A to
Staff 1. Staff 4 reported he did not know where the flowers came
from. Staff 4 reported he never believed the rumors and told
Supervisor 2 about them so she could take care of them. Staff 4
reported he has never seen Staff 1 act inappropriately towards
any youth or bring in extra treats for any youth.
Staff 2:
Staff 2 reported she is a student assistant in the school
department. Staff 2 reported she overheard an unknown staff
state Youth A made a comment he was going to live with Staff 1
when he leaves the facility. Staff 2 reported she overheard
“someone” say Youth A had a crush on Staff 1 but couldn’t
remember who it was. Staff 2 reported she told Staff 1 what was
said, and Staff 1 was upset that Staff 2 was spreading rumors.
Staff 2 reported the next day she reported the information to
Supervisor 2. Staff 2 reported she has never seen Youth A and
Staff 1 interact. Staff 2 reported she never heard anything spoken
by Youth A, herself.
4

DHHS Worker 1 does not have findings.
Documents:
• DHHS Worker 1 provided her interview with Youth A which
included Youth A was interviewed by DHHS Worker 1 on
2/26/24 at the Ingham Academy. DHHS Worker 1 provided
the interview to this consultant. Youth A reported he did not
have an inappropriate relationship with Staff 1 and Staff 1
did not kiss him or provide additional snacks to him.
• There are no incidents, notes or case notes pertaining to
the allegations.
• I reviewed Staff 1’s personnel file. All training and
clearances are up to date. There are no disciplinary action
in her file. Staff 1’s last performance evaluation was
marked as “exceeded expectations.”
• I reviewed Staff 1’s Facebook page and there were no
social media contacts to Youth A
• I reviewed the card from the Hyacinth House Flowers. The
card states, “Happy Valentines Day! XOXO Soul Mate,
From Lon.
• I reviewed the Professional Boundaries Policy which
concluded staff are not to engage in friendship relationships
with youth, unauthorized contact with youth via social
media, face to face contact outside of facility, or encourage
personal relationship outside facility.
Analysis Based on the interviews with supervisors and staff, it appears
rumors began in late August/September concerning Staff 1 and
Youth A. All interviewed did not suspect the rumors to be true but
did not stop the rumors from occurring. Based on the interviews,
Staff 1 told the appropriate personnel when she heard of the
information, yet supervision did not put a stop to the rumors.
Supervisor 1 reported this is normal behavior for the facility and
older staff appear to “haze” staff. There is insufficient evidence to
validate Staff 1 violated the agency’s Professional Boundary’s
Policy.
Technical Assistance:
Technical Assistance was provided concerning staff culture and
supervision responsibility. Administration will want to address the
concerns surrounding inappropriate rumors and false accusations
with their staff. The agency was also advised to record allegations
like these in case notes or incident reports, including the ways it
was resolved.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
